text: Social anthropology studies patterns of behaviour in human societies and cultures. It is the main part of anthropology in the United Kingdom and much of Europe.Dianteill, Erwan, "Cultural Anthropology or Social Anthropology? A Transatlantic Argument", L’Année sociologique 1/2012 (Vol. 62), p. 93-122 . There it is contrasted with cultural anthropology. In the United States, social anthropology is part of cultural anthropology or sociocultural anthropology. == References == Category:Anthropology
title: Social anthropology
